summary: This document is a record of a security conveyance related to an aircraft, specifically a Bell 407 helicopter. It details the parties involved in the loan and security agreement, including the debtor and secured party, and outlines the collateral covered by the conveyance. The document also includes provisions for the release of the collateral and the obligations of the debtor. This document appears to be a legal agreement between Heliko, LLC and a bank regarding a loan and security agreement for aircraft. It outlines the terms of the agreement, including obligations of the customer, rights of the bank, and conditions under which the bank can take possession of collateral. The document also includes provisions for communication and jurisdiction. This document contains various records related to the registration, deregistration, and ownership transfers of a Bell 407 helicopter with serial number 53375. It includes bills of sale, registration applications, and communications with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and Transport Canada, indicating the aircraft's ownership changes and export status.

connections.description: Shantel Young, as the legal examiner, is involved in the recording process for the security conveyance related to 1st Source Bank.
Mark Gunsauls represents the debtor, Helibro LLC, in the agreement with 1st Source Bank, which is the secured party.
David Gunsauls is a member of Heliko, LLC, which is the customer in the loan agreement.
Mike Omani is mentioned as a mentor associated with Heliko, LLC.
Greg M. Hoist is the Vice President of the bank that is a party to the agreement.
Garth Sonnenberg is the president of Copter Lease LLC, which is involved in the ownership of the helicopter.
Both are members of Marv, LLC, which is linked to the ownership of the helicopter.
Walter Binkley is the manager of the FAA Aircraft Registry, overseeing the registration processes for the helicopter.
Darren Indyk is the vice president of Shmitka Air, Inc., which is involved in the registration of the helicopter for international flight.
Jeffrey Phipps is the chief of Operational Airworthiness at Transport Canada, confirming the deregistration of the helicopter.

events.title: Loan and Security Agreement Executed
events.description: A loan and security agreement was executed between Helibro LLC and 1st Source Bank.

events.title: Security Conveyance Recorded
events.description: The security conveyance covering the collateral was recorded by the Civil Aviation Registry.

events.title: Prior Record Search
events.description: A prior record search was performed for the Bell 407 helicopter with serial number 53375.

events.title: Deregistration from Canadian Register
events.description: The Bell 407 helicopter was removed from the Canadian Civil Aircraft Register.

events.title: Sale of Helicopter
events.description: The helicopter was sold and transferred to Copter Lease LLC.

events.title: Temporary Certificate of Registration
events.description: A temporary certificate of registration was issued for the helicopter.

events.title: International Flight Declaration
events.description: A declaration was made for the helicopter's scheduled international flight.

locations: 100 N Michigan St, South Bend, IN 46601
keyFacts: The document records a security conveyance for a Bell 407 helicopter with registration number N405PJ.
The secured party is 1st Source Bank, and the debtor is Helibro LLC.
The security conveyance was recorded on June 3, 2016, under conveyance number SY000344.
Mark Gunsauls is identified as a member and signer for Helibro LLC in the agreement.
Shantel Young is the legal examiner responsible for the recording of the security conveyance.
The document outlines a loan and security agreement between Heliko, LLC and a bank.
David Gunsauls and Mike Omani are signatories for Heliko, LLC.
Greg M. Hoist is the Vice President of the bank involved in the agreement.
The agreement includes provisions for the bank to take possession of collateral in case of default.
The document specifies that communications regarding the agreement can be made via email or fax, acknowledging the risks involved.
The Bell 407 helicopter with serial number 53375 has undergone multiple ownership changes and registrations.
The aircraft was deregistered from the Canadian Civil Aircraft Register on March 31, 2016.
Garth Sonnenberg is the president of Copter Lease LLC, which purchased the helicopter.
Walter Binkley is the manager of the FAA Aircraft Registry, overseeing the registration of the helicopter.
Darren Indyk, as vice president of Shmitka Air, Inc., declared the helicopter's international flight.
